trans-unit.source: Provides a common interface and functionality for classes to add SOAP extension information to a <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> object on a per-method basis.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionReflector"></xref> class
Generates service-specific description information that gets placed in a <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> object corresponding to a binding.

Gets or sets the instance of a class derived from the abstract <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ProtocolReflector"></xref> class that invokes the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionReflector.ReflectMethod*> method.

If you implement a class that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionReflector>`abstract` class, you do not need to implement a class that is derived from <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ProtocolReflector> to invoke the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionReflector.ReflectMethod%2A> method or to set the ReflectionContext property.

The instance of a class derived from the abstract <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ProtocolReflector"></xref> class that invokes the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionReflector.ReflectMethod*> method.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_Abstract" name="Abstract" href=""></xref> method that a derived class must implement to add SOAP extension information to a <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> object on a per-method basis.
TheReflectMethodmethod is called for each Web method that belongs to a binding that the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription>represents.
The ReflectMethod method does not use the Web method directly.
The SOAP extension information gets added for all Web methods in a binding reflected from a Web service class.
An implementation of the ReflectMethod can generate information like operation binding, `abstract` operation, and messages.
